data.title: Rev Richard Bruce Stopford
data.text:
Birth2 Mar 1774, (Bapt in) Westminster, Middlesex

Baptism27 Mar 1773, St George, Hanover Square, London

Death12 Dec 1844, Greenwich district, London

GeneralClergyman. A chaplain to the Queen, canon of Windsor. Rector of Barton Seagrave.

MotherMary Powys (1737-1810)

Notes for Rev Richard Bruce Stopford

His baptism transcription:

First name(s) Richard Bruce

Last name Stopford

Birth year 1774

Birth date 02 Mar 1774

Baptism year 1774

Baptism date 27 Mar 1774

Father's first name(s) James

Mother's first name(s) Mary

Parish St George, Hanover Square

County Middlesex

Country England

Page 170

Archive City of Westminster Archives Centre

Record set Westminster Baptisms

I would guess he was born in Westminster, London.

__________________

The transcript from the Register page, thanks Ancestry, made by me, is:

[ St George, Hanover Square > 1767-1787 ]

“ Baptized Baptisms 1774 March Born

“. . . .

“27 Honble. Richard Bruce Stopford S. of the Rt Honble. James 2

“ & Mary Earl & Countess of Courtown

__________________

From Joseph Foster’s Alumni Oxoniensis, 1715-1886, vol 4, p. 1361:

Stopford, Richard Bruce, s. James, Earl of Courtown. CHRIST CHURCH, matric. 30 April 1792, aged 18; BA 1796, MA 1799, rector of Barton Seagrave Northants, 1790, vicar of Nuneston, co. Warwick, 1803, chaplain to the Queen, preb. of Hereford 1810, Canon of Windsor 1812, until his death 2 Dec ., 1844, father of the next named [Robert Stopford]. See Foster’s Peerage & Eton School Lists.

______________________

This looks like him and his family in 1841:

Name Sex Age Birth Year Occupation Where Born

STOPFORD, Richard M 65 1776

STOPFORD, Eleanor F 65 1776

STOPFORD, Charles M 30 1811 Northamptonshire

STOPFORD, Harriet F 20 1821 Northamptonshire

GILES, Jane F 25 1816

BELLHAM, Mary F 30 1811

GREEN, Sarah F 20 1821

COLEMAN, Joyce F 20 1821 Northamptonshire

BELL, Ann F 20 1821 Northamptonshire

TOWNDREW, Elizabeth F 20 1821 Northamptonshire

NEWTON, Am F 20 1821

HARRIS, George M 25 1816

DAWKINS, Charles M 20 1821 Northamptonshire

BEEBY, Lawrence M 20 1821 Northamptonshire

RG number: HO107, Piece: 803, Book/Folio: 6/7, Page: 9

Registration District: Kettering Sub District: Kettering

Enumeration District: Ecclesiastical Parish:

Civil Parish: Barton Seagrave Municipal Borough:

Address: Barton Village Rectory House, Barton Seagrave

County: Northamptonshire

__________________

Their children, from a search for Stopfords baptised between 1801 and 1821 in England and with parents’ forenames of Richard and Eleanor:

Date Name Location Register copy Birth

==== ==== ======== ============= =====

1804 Jan 1st Richard Henry Barton Segrave BTs 1706-1812 Y

do do do Parish Reg 1609-1810 Y

1805 Feb 24 Charles Barton Segrave PR do Y

1816 Oct 20 Harriet Jane Barton Segrave PR Clergyman Y

1813 Jun 15 Robert Barton Segrave PR Clergyman Y

1806 Apr 27 William Barton Segrave BT â¦ Y

1801 Oct 4 George Powys Petersham Surrey PR â¦ Y 29 Aug 1801

St Peter

1802 Oct 3 Eleanor Eliz’ Barton Segrave . . . Y

? Plus from 1841 census: Harriett b. in 1815-1821 in Northants.

Burke’s Peerage, various, adds

James Sydney, b. Apr 1808, m. +issue

Edward, b. 20 Aug 1809, m. _ issue

Lucy Charlotte who m.

issue to Eleanor Elizabeth

issue to Harriet Jane.

Burke, modern, omits George Powys, who became a cleric and was unmarried in 1849.

So the revised list is, mostly for St Botolph, Barton Segrave, Northants:

Birth Name Birth Loc Birth Day PR/BT Copy

===== ==== ========= ========= ==========

1801, 29 Aug George Powys Petersham, Surrey 29 Aug 1801 on PR Y

1802, 3 Oct Eleanor Eliz’ Barton Segrave Y

1804, 1 Jan Richard Henry Barton Segrave 22 Nov 1803 ex BP Y

1805, 24 Feb Charles Barton Segrave 19 Jan 1905 ex BP Y

1806, 27 Apr William Barton Segrave 1 Apr 1806 ex BP Y

1808, 22 May James Sydney Barton Segrave 14 Apr 1808 ex BP Y

1809, 8 Oct Edward Barton Segrave 20 Aug 1809 ex BP Y

1811, 18 Dec Lucy Charlotte Barton Segrave Y

1813, 15 Jun Robert Barton Segrave 16 Apr 1813 ex BP Y

1816, 20 Oct Harriet Jane Barton Segrave Y

2021 Sept, TFPL: Burke says they had seven sons and three daus. The baptisms for all ten of these have now been found with copies taken of the register or BT pages.

____________________

He was rector of Barton Seagrave for 40 odd years.

____________________

His death index:

Name: Age at Death (in years):

STOPFORD, RICHARD BRUCE 70

GRO Reference: 1844 D Quarter in GREENWICH UNION Volume 05 Page 172

___________________

DNB Main notes for Rev Richard Bruce Stopford

From Who Was Who, probably a grandson:

STOPFORD, Francis Powys (1861-1935)

Details: STOPFORD, Francis Powys, journalist and essayist; born

Westbourne Lodge, 6 December 1861; 3rd son of late Rev. F. M. Stopford (Chaplain in Ordinary to Queen Victoria and Hon. Chaplain to Edward VII, George V), and Florence Augusta, youngest daughter of Charles Saunders, one of the founders and first Sec. Great Western Railway.

Work: Has cultivated coffee on the hills of South India, also tea, cinchona, pepper, cocoa, and Manila hemp; one of the founders of the Planters' Association of Southern India, 1893; has worked on staff, in some instances edited, Madras Times, Madras Mail, Civil and Military Gazette of Lahore, Daily Mail, Daily Express, St James' Gazette, Standard, Evening Standard, The World, and Land and Water.

Publications: The Planting Industry of Southern India, 1896; The Toil of Life, 1907; Life's Great Adventure, 1912; Fleet Street and Downing Street (with Kennedy Jones), 1919; Romance of the Jewel, 1920.

Address: 44 High Street, Kingston-on-Thames.

Died: 21 January 1935

___________________________________________
